page.title: 19WHITTONSTALL CHURCH HALL
page.content: {WHITTONSTALL CHURCH HALL}IS USED BY ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY AS A VENUE FOR LARGE GATHERINGS SUCH AS DANCES ,COOKERY DEMONSTRATIONS,PUBLIC MEETINGS AND SOCIAL EVENTS LIKE CHRISTENING AND FUNERAL TEAS. THE HALL IS RUN BY A SMALL COMMITTEE WHO ORGANISE FUND-RAISING TO PAY FORITS UPKEEP.IT IS ACTUALLY OWNED BY THE CHURCH. THE BUILDING WAS ORIGINALLY CONSTRUCTED TO REHOUSE THE PUPILS OF THE VERY FIRST SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE AND REMAINED IN USE AS A SCHOOL UNTIL THE OPENING OF THE PRESENT "TEMPORARY" BUILDING IN 1912 ONE ORGANISATION WHICH USES THE HALL REGULARLY IS THE{WOMENS INSTITUTE } WHICH MEETS ON THE FIRST TUESDAY OF EACH MONTH.
